adrFormatAddress: 1450 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA

editorialSummary.text: Snug Japanese eatery turning out sushi rolls, ramen & bento-boxes in an unadorned space.

originalText.text:
Great Japanese restaurant with extremely reasonable pricing especially considering the location. $13-$15 for a bento box is almost unheard of in this area. I can finally indulge in my favorite food without going broke! This place offers a large variety of dishes, their own delivery service (which costs slightly less than third party delivery companies), and the food is excellent with generous portions. The staff are very nice and eager to please.

It seems they mostly serve take-out and deliver orders as the atmosphere in the restaurant itself leaves much to be desired. They also serve dine-in meals using only plastic which was a turn off for me. Hopefully they will be able to make some improvements in the future.

In regard to their delivery service, we only waited about 30-45 minutes before they were at our door and the food was hot and fresh unlike DoorDash or other delivery companies which tend to make stops along the way. Overall, I highly recommend this place. It is a hidden gem!

originalText.text: I’ve lived near this place for years and it has been my consistent takeout joint. The place is Chinese owned and operated, quality is fresh and the staff works quickly. My partner who is vegetarian also loves their options and I take it as a good sign that I’ve never gotten sick of or sick from eating here. The menu is crazy extensive, they offer a variety of different types of Asian cuisines outside of sushi, from pad thai to ramen, bentos and donburi bowls. Would definitely recommend the sushi rolls over some of the noodle dishes. It’s not a glam place to take out of towners, but a simple, no frills, solid takeout option after a long workday-kind of place with some seating if you don’t want to deal with packaging. Last note is they close well before 10, generally around 9:30-9:45 at the latest for orders and you’ll definitely not be allowed to dine in after 9:20.

originalText.text: This is the worst sushi I have ever had. I never gave a one star rating but for this time, I have to. I ordered sushi for two. The fish was not fresh at all, and the brown rice tasted bland and dry, and there was a weird disgusting smell from the ginger. I forced myself to eat some because I don’t want to waste food and money. For the rest, I have thrown away. Will never come back. Low quality sushi.

text.text: This is the worst sushi I have ever had. I never gave a one star rating but for this time, I have to. I ordered sushi for two. The fish was not fresh at all, and the brown rice tasted bland and dry, and there was a weird disgusting smell from the ginger. I forced myself to eat some because I don’t want to waste food and money. For the rest, I have thrown away. Will never come back. Low quality sushi.

originalText.text: My go-to Sunday takeout spot for sushi. Ordered the Love Boat which comes 10 pc sushi, 15 piece sashimi, and 2 special rolls. Special rolls we got were Pink Lady and Dynamite. Nothing too fancy, but generous cuts and affordability for the price you pay. Only thing I'd want is if they had a wider variety of sushi/sashimi like sea urchin, salmon belly, yellowtail belly, but all in all I love this place for takeout. Staff is very accommodating to your order notes. Don't sleep on this place, people

originalText.text: Sushi was ok. Service could have been better. They don’t offer plates so we all had to eat from the same sushi trays . Probably won’t go back
